Northern Arc COVID-19 Livelihood Support Project (IND RRP 50238) 
DETAILS OF IMPLEMENTATION ARRANGEMENTS 
 
A.  Use of Proceeds 
 
1.  Northern Arc Capital Limited (NACL) will use the proceeds of the Asian Development 
Bank’s (ADB) investment to directly fund or provide guarantees to NACL’s nonbank financial 
company and small finance bank clients, micro-borrowers, and micro-, small-, and medium-sized 
enterprises. A small part of ADB’s proceeds will be used to provide housing loans to the 
economically weaker section and low-income groups.1  
 
2.  ADB will make a senior secured debt investment in NACL of up to $50 million (in Indian 
rupee equivalent) by subscribing to nonconvertible debentures (NCDs). If a regulatory change 
makes it unfeasible to structure the financing as an NCD issuance, ADB may provide a bilateral 
loan to NACL on substantially the same terms. ADB may enter into risk transfers with eligible 
counterparties for a portion of the exposure.  
 
B.  Legal Documentation 
 
3.  The proposed debt financing will be governed by transaction documentation appropriate 
to the debt financing modality and will be in form and substance satisfactory to ADB. For an NCD 
transaction, such documentation may include (i) a subscription agreement, (ii) an offering memo, 
and (iii) an investment prospectus.  
 
4.  For a bilateral loan, such documentation may include a credit agreement, which will 
contain terms customary for loans of this nature and amount. 
 
5.  Documentation for either the NCD or the bilateral loan will include the following provisions: 
(i)  conditions precedent and delivery of all relevant legal opinions, all necessary 
approvals, and documents required by the relevant authorities in India; 
(ii)  provisions relating to the use of proceeds; 
(iii)  conditions to disbursement; 
(iv)  fees and costs, including increased costs; 
(v)  representations and warranties; 
(vi)  reporting requirements; 
(vii)  affirmative and negative covenants (including information covenants); 
(viii)  default and acceleration events;  
(ix)  provisions for mandatory prepayment or suspension in the event of breach of 
covenants and/or representations; and 
(x)  a security package. 
   
 
1  Government of India, Ministry of Housing and Urban Poverty Alleviation. 2017. Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojna (PMAY). 
Delhi. The ministry defines those in the economically weaker section as having a family income of less than ₹0.3 
million per annum; in low-income groups, ₹0.3 million–₹0.6 million; and in the middle-income group, above ₹0.6 
million and less than ₹1.8 million.

2 
C.  Monitoring and Reporting Arrangements 
 
6.  ADB  will  monitor  the  project.  NACL  will  provide  ADB  with  financial  reports  at 
predetermined intervals and as requested, including (i) quarterly unaudited financial statements, 
(ii) annual audited financial statements, (iii) quarterly compliance certificates for agreed-upon 
financial covenants, (iv) semiannual reporting on the use of ADB investment proceeds, (v) annual 
reporting  on  selected  development  indicators  agreed  by  ADB  and  the  borrower,  and  (vi) 
monitoring of the implementation of the gender action plan.  
 
D.  Evaluation 
 
7.  ADB will be preparing regular monitoring reports  at least on an annual basis. The first 
such report will be prepared no later than 12 months after the first disbursement.
